title: Too many red flags and inconsistencies will USCIS suspect Marriage Fraud. What are the chances of them passing first interview?
question: Female came here on J1 lost job within 4 weeks. Not required to do 2 year ban. Her and male boyfriend/friend went to Canada and got tourist visa. They were married 3 months later. Filed I-485 7 months after marriage. They live together, set up joint bank account and she has not worked since being fired from J1 job. She now has boyfriend in another state and still married living with husband. No wedding pictures at courthouse. Few pix of them together. Her facebook was filled with picture of her and her BF not her husband. Close friends and family do not know about marriage. Husband convicted of domestic abuse on her, wife has history of mental illness, a suicide attempts and documented alcohol addiction in her home country and USA. Outstanding USA medical debt totaling about $9,000
answers: Doesn't look good at all. USCIS is sure to thoroughly investigate.
Certainly sounds suspicious and likely USCIS will investigate. However, Why are you involved in this situation?
